intro: Verbesina acosta-solisii, commonly known as the Mexican beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
